ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 30 May 2000, Shawn Alley wrote:

> one thing to remember about purchasing spells is there are some which can't
> be purchased. In this respect questing for spells is also known as
> research. Bummer there's no exp for researching a spell I don't think
> (haven't made one yet) but you can make your own spells.

No XP for researching a spell. There are some quests which result in a
spell, though, and some of those give xp. None for low-level enchanters
that I know of though.

> Clerics have a few of these quests and I'm sure other classes do to. It's
> just a lot easier if you can quest for your spell at the low levels when
> restarting on another server. Thanks for the info though.

What spell quest have you EVER seen that is easier than purchasing the
same-level spell? More intellectually rewarding? perhaps. Easier? No
way.

1st level spells are expensive without twinking, 8th are expensive, 12th
mildly expensive. Aside from those levels, they cost a lot but you should
be earning a whole lot more than they cost.

However, the time and risk spent on a quest are almost always greater than
hunting things with good loot and buying the spell.
